thread.title: At least 6 wounded in Calumet City driveby shooting Monday night - Daily Southtown
thread.title_full: At least 6 wounded in Calumet City drive-by shooting Monday night - Daily Southtown

author: Tribune staff report
title: At least 6 wounded in Calumet City driveby shooting Monday night - Daily Southtown
text:
At least six people were wounded Monday night in a drive-by shooting outside a Calumet City home where mourners had gathered after a funeral, police said.
A seventh person was injured, but investigators had not been able to determine if the person was shot or injured in a fall, Calumet City police Chief Edward Gilmore said Tuesday morning.
Gilmore said about 30 to 40 people had gathered at the house in the 300 block of Campbell Avenue. Some of those people walked to a nearby liquor store where, according to Gilmore, they got into an altercation with others.
Soon after the group returned to the home, about 7:30 p.m., a car drove by and shots were fired, Gilmore said. Three of the injured were in serious but stable condition, he said. One was being treated at Stroger Hospital in Chicago, another at Advocate Christ Medical Center in Oak Lawn and a third at Ingalls Memorial Hospital in Harvey.
Franciscan St. Margaret Hospital in Hammond treated four people, but their conditions and status were unknown, Gilmore said.
The South Suburban Major Crimes Task Force is assisting with the investigation. No one was in custody. Gilmore did not have a description of the car and did not know how many people were in it.
